pullRequest.title: Add az namespace span attribute for App config
pullRequest.bodyText:
Ref #7049
In this PR, instrumenting only AppConfig client library for the az namespace span atttribute update.

nodes.bodyText: Does this have to be hardcoded? Can this be made configurable instead?
Can we include tracing in the name of this context key? This will make it clear as to what this key is used for. AZ_NAMESPACE is too generic.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -57,6 +57,11 @@
      */
     String SPAN_BUILDER_KEY = "builder";
 
+    /**
+     * Key for {@link Context} which indicates that the context contains the Azure resource provider namespace.
+     */
+    String AZ_NAMESPACE_KEY = "az.namespace";

nodes.bodyText: How reliably can we determine whether the SwaggerInterfaceParser's serviceName will contain the expected names here? Instead within RestProxy could we retrieve the name of the package where the method exists and pass through an additional context value which will be a bit more robust compared to either a codegen name/hand-written name?
This is the OpenTelemetry package, should revert the comment renames.
Should this add the attribute if the parsed name is ""? It appear in the policy it doesn't.

beforeCommit.message: update app config with az namespace span attribute update

nodes.bodyText: call the other constructor from here instead of duplicating initialization code in both constructors.
same here - call this create method from the other create overload method
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -685,4 +729,25 @@ private static HttpPipeline createDefaultPipeline(HttpPipelinePolicy credentials
         return (A) Proxy.newProxyInstance(swaggerInterface.getClassLoader(), new Class<?>[]{swaggerInterface},
             restProxy);
     }
+
+    /**
+     * Create a proxy implementation of the provided Swagger interface.
+     *
+     * @param swaggerInterface the Swagger interface to provide a proxy implementation for
+     * @param httpPipeline the HttpPipelinePolicy and HttpClient pipeline that will be used to send Http
+     *     requests
+     * @param serializer the serializer that will be used to convert POJOs to and from request and
+     *     response bodies
+     * @param <A> the type of the Swagger interface.
+     * @param tracerSpanAttributes the attributes to be set on the tracer spans.
+     * @return a proxy implementation of the provided Swagger interface
+     */
+    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
+    public static <A> A create(Class<A> swaggerInterface, HttpPipeline httpPipeline, SerializerAdapter serializer,
+        TracerSpanAttributes tracerSpanAttributes) {
+        final SwaggerInterfaceParser interfaceParser = new SwaggerInterfaceParser(swaggerInterface, serializer);

nodes.bodyText:
Since this has just one attribute now, I am assuming new attributes will be added later. If that's the intent, then shouldn't we make this a fluent API? A public constructor with just one attribute now will result in breaking changes if we need more attributes here later.
Alternatively, do we need this attributes class, if all fields in here are going to be String types? Can we instead use Map<String, String> as properties bag?

nodes.bodyText: I am not sure why we are using unreleased for this. There's also this on L8 - com.azure:azure-core;1.2.0;1.3.0-beta.1
